com.vmware.vapi.bindings.client

Class AsyncCallback<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vmware.vapi.bindings.client.AsyncCallback<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the operation result; for void type, use java.lang.Void
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncCallbackFuture, AsyncCallbackSyncAdapter

    public abstract class AsyncCallback<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This callback is used to receive the status (progress, result or error) of an asynchronous operation invocation.

    Multiple progress updates can arrive for an operation. Note that progress updates might be delivered after the result. For example consider client with an application thread pool - the thread that delivers a progress update might be scheduled before the thread that delivers the result.

    Thread-safety: The implementation must be thread-safe. The methods of the callback might be invoked on different threads (for example consider client with an I/O reactor thread pool and/or an application thread pool).

      • onProgress

        public abstract void onProgress(Progress progress)
        Reports progress for the operation invocation.
        Parameters:
        progress - progress status of the operation invocation

      • onResult

        public abstract void onResult(T result)
        Completes the invocation with a result object.
        Parameters:
        result - operation result

      • onError

        public abstract void onError(java.lang.RuntimeException error)
        Completes the invocation with an error. The error can be a legal/allowed vAPI error (e.g. descendant of Error) coming from the provider; UnresolvedError if the client bindings do not recognize the vAPI error from the provider; ClientException if the client-side runtime reports an error (e.g. network failure) or some other unchecked exception like IllegalArgumentException if an internal problem occurs in the client-side runtime.
        Parameters:
        error - operation error
